sentences.en: “Let me talk about a typical day in the life of yours truly”(&b{Robert A. Spivey})
sentences.cn: “让我来谈谈我现实生活中代表性的一天”(&b{罗伯特A.斯皮维})

sentences.en: "This ain't no affair of yours, boy!" McClosky said threateningly.
sentences.cn: “小子，这不关你的事！”麦克洛斯基威胁道。

sentences.en: "Up yours," said the reporter and stormed out into the street.
sentences.cn: “去你的，”记者边说边怒气冲冲地冲到大街上。

sentences.en: A cash prize of £10,000 or a new car – the choice is yours.
sentences.cn: 一万英镑的奖金或一辆新车——随你选择。

sentences.en: A lot of people have money problems, but yours are more serious than most people’s.
sentences.cn: 许多人有财务问题，不过你的问题比大多数人的要严重。

sentences.en: Do relatives of yours still live in Siberia?
sentences.cn: 你的亲属仍然住在西伯利亚吗？

sentences.en: His trick is cut from the same cloth as yours.
sentences.cn: 他的这套把戏与你的手段是一路货色.

sentences.en: I found this book kicking around upstairs; is it yours?
sentences.cn: 我发现这本书被丢在楼上, 是你的 吗 ?

sentences.en: I love my country as you love yours.
sentences.cn: 我热爱我的祖国，就像你热爱你的祖国一样。

sentences.en: I'll take my coat upstairs. Shall I take yours, Roberta?
sentences.cn: 我要把我的外套拿到楼上去。罗伯塔，要我把你的也拿上去吗？

sentences.en: My opinion is on the whole the same as yours.
sentences.cn: 我的意见大体上同你的差不多.

sentences.en: Please stay out of my business and I'll stay out of yours.
sentences.cn: 请别管我的事,我也不管你的事.

sentences.en: The difference between her wages and yours is only fractional.
sentences.cn: 她的薪水和你的只差一点点.

sentences.en: This is my pen, and yours is on the table.
sentences.cn: 这是我的钢笔, 你的在桌子上.

sentences.en: This is our room, and yours is just across the hall.
sentences.cn: 这是我们的房间，你们的在走廊那边。

sentences.en: Waiting to hear from you, Yours sincerely, William Faulkner.
sentences.cn: 盼复，您的诚挚的，威廉·福克纳

sentences.en: We sowed our vegetable seed yesterday. Have you sown yours?
sentences.cn: 昨天我们播下了菜籽, 你也播了 吗 ?

sentences.en: Yours truly was awoken by a shout: "Ahoy there!"
sentences.cn: 鄙人被一声大喊惊醒：“喂！”

trans.tran_cn: 你（们）的（东西）；信末署名前用语

trans.tran_en: used when speaking or writing to one or more people to refer to something that belongs to them or is connected with them

trans.tran_cn: 你/您/你们的（东西），你/您的（书信结尾的签名前）
trans.tran_en: used when speaking or writing to one or more people to refer to something that belongs to them or is connected with them
